website_summaries.verdict: One of the most realistic airplane model kits to choose for an extra authentic build project.
pros: Highly detailed surfaces offer a visually pleasing model once constructed
Features optional working flaps and wings for more realism
cons: The details on certain parts are hard to notice once the plane is fully painted, depending on the color

customer_reviews.title: Awesome livery
customer_reviews.text: it was a great kit, first one I've done since I was 10 so it was cool to have a kit with such detail, I kinda did my own thing with the decals, it was really fun!!
customer_reviews.author: N. Mahalic

customer_reviews.title: Tamiya produces some of the best aircraft models available
customer_reviews.text: Tamiya produces some of the best aircraft models available. After seeing the F4U-4 Corsair in flight and in photographs I had to have this for my collection. As an added bonus, it offers the choice of folded or extended wings. My only regret is that this model does not provide a seated pilot.
customer_reviews.author: Paladin

customer_reviews.title: Not since he was a kid.
customer_reviews.text: A surprise gift for my brother. He was going through chemo and I thought this would lift his spirits and occupy his time. He loved it.
customer_reviews.author: kathyskatch

customer_reviews.title: Uncharacteristic dud from Tamiya
customer_reviews.text: I’ve built many Tamiya kits and this one was the first time I’ve been disappointed. Maybe I got a bad sample, but the alignment was way out whack. About the only area that went together well was the cockpit. I was able to get it looking decent until I got to the flaps portion. I ended up giving up on it because nothing I did would make the flaps align.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: just as good as revell
customer_reviews.text: not finished yet* work on it when I get a chance but parts fit well and take GOOD latex paint well or use enamel the reason for the 4 I wish the pilot was able to be seated PS I like to take my time with these things
customer_reviews.author: stevan j anselmi

customer_reviews.title: Tamiya models are at the top of my good list. The directions are easy to follow the ...
customer_reviews.text: Tamiya models are at the top of my good list. The directions are easy to follow the parts fit well. The box art and paint list match. That all makes for good fun.
customer_reviews.author: William W Gauthier

customer_reviews.title: Well crafted
customer_reviews.text: Admire the detail that Tamiya puts into their models. Highly recommend to all model builders who can appreciate the contribution that this aircraft and its' brave pilots had to history.
customer_reviews.author: Edward J.

customer_reviews.title: ... building a model airplane and could not have been happier with the quality of the kit
customer_reviews.text: This was my first attempt in thirty years at building a model airplane and could not have been happier with the quality of the kit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good kit
customer_reviews.text: Nice kit - plenty of detail but fairly easy to assemble. Like the fact it can be assembled with wings in folded position.
customer_reviews.author: Smokeymike

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Another example of Tamiya excellence. Great detail and a great model.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Such a great product!
customer_reviews.text: My first model since I was a kid. A GREAT product to jump back into modeling. I built this for my Dad, and I am very impressed with the fitment and overall look of the plane. I complimented it with the Edwards PE cockpit set that really sets the product apart.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Z

customer_reviews.title: Old school planes
customer_reviews.text: Love the old school planes. Tamiya is always a leader.
customer_reviews.author: Haireball

customer_reviews.title: Nice Details and quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality model, bought for my 10 year old son and he only needed a little help and there. It was 3 gluing mode he ever built
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: The product is very good.  It just took a very long time to get it.
customer_reviews.text: As I said, the product is very good, but it just took an inordinate amount of time to receive the product. That I don't like. I think it came on a slow boat from China.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M. Ashby

customer_reviews.title: Great kit typical Tamiya quality
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint is the kit does not include rockets for the rails included in this boxing
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Very nice model as usual for Tamiya
customer_reviews.text: Very nice model as usual for Tamiya, good fit, good decals, one of the best American planes in the Pacific. The sky changed from Japanese to american. The Hellcat was a hell of a plane too.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Andre

customer_reviews.title: good kit
customer_reviews.text: this was a mistake on my part i stuffed it up because i didnt follow the instructions properly.but the kit is great
customer_reviews.author: Michael bell e28

customer_reviews.title: Great kid!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful model. Even if you suck at model making it’ll look good.
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: High quality model that has come to be expected from Tamiya. A pleasure to build.
customer_reviews.author: David Dean

customer_reviews.title: fit is perfect and detail is good
customer_reviews.text: As expected from Tamiya, fit is perfect and detail is good.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Woo

customer_reviews.title: Tamiya F4U-1D Corsair - superb detailing!
customer_reviews.text: A superb version of the earlier Corsair fighter. Excellent interior detail! Wish it were more visible, as a lot of that nice work is hidden in the finished kit. The wings gave me trouble, as I glued them in extended configuration. A bit flimsy, and hard to get everything lined up smoothly - this is NOT a beginner's kit. Final model is very nice indeed! It put's the Revell F4U-4 kit to shame detailwise. This is definitely a must-have for your WWII Navy Aircraft collection.
customer_reviews.author: NRevellTop Contributor: Architecture

customer_reviews.title: Got it for my father and he loved it. Was even delivered days before it was ...
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my father and he loved it. Was even delivered days before it was suppose to arrive. Perfection, thank you
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: A very good model kit.
customer_reviews.text: Very good as most Tamiya models are. Goes together well and can be made in two configurations.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd R.

customer_reviews.title: Looks good for my air force
customer_reviews.text: I hung this after completion above my train layout along with a B39. Looks good for my air force.
customer_reviews.author: Jim T.

customer_reviews.title: Great for desktop display.
customer_reviews.text: It's a little smaller than I anticipated but I will make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Downey Rob

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: Parts are very flimsy and break easily. All three wheels and the propeller have Broken. My son enjoyed building the model until his frustration took over with the broken parts.
customer_reviews.author: Rick M.

customer_reviews.title: Three weeks!
customer_reviews.text: The product itself was just fine, but it took three weeks for them to get it to me. It's 2017. NOTHING takes three weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating Wing Gaps
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint that I have about this model is that the with the wings extended in the flying position, you will have gaps between the inboard and outboard wing sections This cannot be avoided. It has happened on EVERY Corsair model I have ever assembled, so be prepared to fill and sand the filler in the gaps. The parts just don't line up precisely enough to avoid the gaps. This was frustrating and disappointing as everything else went together perfectly. Even with filler, sanding and repainting, the left wing still doesn't look right.
customer_reviews.author: Richard P. Lahan

customer_reviews.title: Great model, decals rip easily though.
customer_reviews.text: This model I built for my grandpa and was good. The plastic is incredibly thick and strong, it’s very hard to break a piece. The only problem is the decals, I ended up painting some of the decals, they break easily, I would’ve done five stars. I don’t recommend it for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Review

customer_reviews.title: Superb Tamiya quality as expected.
customer_reviews.text: A most enjoyable building experience that produces an outstanding model. The engineering is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Nacreous

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS AN AOWESOME CRAFT TO BUILD & ITS plain to see why, just ask pappy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great detail
customer_reviews.text: This is my second build and I can not say enough about Tamiya quality and fit. This model is flawless as far as fit and detail. I built many model kits in my younger days but none came close to the attention to detail and precision of directions. Amazon makes it easy to find what you are looking for and offers anything you need to get the job done completely satisfied with their service.
customer_reviews.author: arthur rhea

product_meta.title: Tamiya 61061 1/48 Vought F4U-1D Corsair Plastic Model Airplane Kit
product_meta.description: The F4U Corsair was a formidable combination of speed and firepower and was the mount of numerous aces during WWII. This kit depicts the F4U-1D variant, which was first deployed aboard U. S. Navy aircraft carriers in April 1944. Distinctive features such as the higher pilot seat position, taller tailwheel, and wider propeller blades have been accurately reproduced, and the model may also be assembled with wings folded. A pilot figure, drop tanks, and two types of canopy windshield are included together with markings for three aircraft flown by U. S. aces. ??Requires paint and assembly.
